010package imagingbook.common.corners;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This is an implementation of the Harris/Stephens corner detector, as
019 * described in [1]. See Sec. 6.2 of [2] for additional details. This class
020 * extends {@link GradientCornerDetector} (where most of the work is done) by
021 * defining a specific corner score function.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] C. G. Harris and M. Stephens. A combined corner and edge detector. In C.
025 * J. Taylor, editor, 4th Alvey Vision Conference, pp. 147â€“151, Manchester
026 * (1988). <br>
027 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/03/30
033 */
034public class HarrisCornerDetector extends GradientCornerDetector {
035        
036        public static final double DefaultAlpha = 0.05;
037
038        private double alpha = DefaultAlpha;
039
040        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
041        
042        public HarrisCornerDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
043                super(ip, params);
044        }
045        
046        /**
047         * Set the sensitivity parameter &alpha; (alpha) for the corner score function.
048         * @param alpha sensitivity parameter (default is 0.05)
049         */
050        public void setAlpha(double alpha) {
051                this.alpha = alpha;
052        }
053        
054        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
055
056        @Override
057        protected float getCornerScore(float a, float b, float c) {
058                double det = a * b - sqr(c);
059                double trace = a + b;
060                double score = det - alpha * sqr(trace);
061                return (float) Math.sqrt(0.5 * score);  // returns 100 for default threshold = 20000
062        }
063        
064}
